course_title: Fresh Sem: Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies: Humanitarian Inter.SexualViol.
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 6 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as AFS 190 1)
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(This course examines key moments of conflict and the work of humanitarian organizations involved in trying to give aid to victims of sexual violence in wartime. Major topics include the use of rape in the conflict in Rwanda; attempts by local and international organizations such as the United Nations, V-Day and Doctors without Borders to address sexual violence; and critiques of humanitarian and development aid. Films, books, articles, and primary documents from the United Nations and international humanitarian organizations serve as our source material. This class is run as a participatory seminar. You are expected to do all the reading and to come to class on time ready to engage.)
course_description: For first-year students only. Entry level seminar focusing on a specific topic.
